Reviews.Title: LG OPTIMUS Q CELL PHONE - NET 10
Reviews.Author: Joanne Bryan
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a Christmas present and my daughter-in-law loves it.  She had an LG phone on Net 10, but she hated that the keyboard was very difficult for her to use.  She told me that this will help her send texts to her family and friends and that she was having difficulty sending accurate messages to.  For the money that I spent for this phone, it was well worth it.  The price was very affordable and it was very easy for me to get pictures of this phone to show her daughter and get her input. I would recommend this phone for anybody who has difficulty texting.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: C. J. Myers "NGinEar32"
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone to use with Net10. The LG website says it is discontinued, but it does everything I need & I love the QWERTY keyboard. It has a virtual keyboard, but I always use the QWERTY keyboard...think it's easier. Battery lasts 4 to 5 days. May not have all the bells and whistles oh higher end smart phones, but internet works well & service is great. Definitely a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Don't purchase this piece of junk
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: This is beyond the shadow of a doubt the most hideous phone i have ever used! It crashes continuously! there was one night i had to remove and reinstall the battery to get it to restart like 10 times! Also one evening it simply stopped receiving txt msgs...I didnt realize until i restarted the phone the next day and had like 10 Msgs from the previous evening....I HATE THIS PHONE!! and the battery life sucks too....i bought the LG Optimus Showtime to replace it....hopefully that will work better...

Reviews.Title: Good, if you know why you're using it
Reviews.Author: Eliwood
Reviews.Content: I've had the LG Optimus Q for about two years now, and I must say that at the time when I had bought it, it was a fantastic phone.  Why was it a fantastic phone?  Because it met all of the needs I needed it to do.Let me explain.I got my phone because I wanted to do one thing.  Communicate.  I didn't get it to browse the internet, tumblr, or just in general any of those things.  I got it so I could communicate with friends who did not have cell phones.  This meant using apps like Android Messenger ((which ended up being an MSN messenger for Android)), Skype, and Steam.  These were what I used to communicate with friends.Of course after about a year+ I realized that I had wanted a bit more out of my phone.  I know it sounds kind of silly because why would I need my phone for anything other than communicating?  Well browsing the web was honestly unacceptable.  Tumblr worked kind of okay, but that's about it.  Nothing to write home about.  Around a year and a half is when my phone started to break down and I was kind of sick of it.  Constantly crashing and things not working anymore, just in general wasn't really that good.  I was not pleased around the end of its life.All and all I'd have to say that if you want to use this for just communication purposes, this phone may be the right one for you, in the beginning.  I'd have to say it's a great intro for those who might be new to smartphones but aren't sure they want to do much.  Don't get this phone for playing games or running apps though.  While it may run a few, this device was not optimized to be doing so.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for your money
Reviews.Author: Maggie Brothers
Reviews.Content: First time smart phone user. I wanted a prepaid phone, I hate contracts and needed a QWERTY keyboard and this was perfect. My friend owned hers for over a year and recommended it to me. Only things that I don't like about it, battery life is terrible, it's pretty heavy, especially with a cover case, it restarts on it's own sometimes and when browsing the web it sometimes won't stay on the page, it'll go back to where you previously where. Other than that, The touch screen is on point, customization is great, service is pretty good (in my area), I ordered it on a Friday and it came on Monday just in time because my other phone ran out and also it was cheaper to buy this here (including shipping) than if you bought it at Best Buy or something.

Reviews.Title: Sweet
Reviews.Author: Irafutabel
Reviews.Content: Product is Satisfactory, does what it supposed to do like the old school key board. Great buy for the price. Sweet

Reviews.Title: Fast Servic
Reviews.Author: Katherine A. Wright
Reviews.Content: Thank you for getting the phone to me as fast as you did and I really enjoying the phone and all the things you can do on it.

Reviews.Title: awesome phone!
Reviews.Author: melody helms
Reviews.Content: I love the slider ability and the full keyboard! The phone is not too big and I can dress it up with tons of colorful covers!

Reviews.Title: It'srefurbished, but still.
Reviews.Author: Regan Gilmore
Reviews.Content: I know I bought a refurbished product but it has more glitches than I bargained for. It turns itself off, it freezes up, and sometimes the apps don't work or are very slow. I was hoping it would work better for longer, but instead it's not meeting my expectation.

Reviews.Title: This works fine for my usage.
Reviews.Author: tylerad3
Reviews.Content: This is not a whizbang superphone like some of the smart phones sold these days.  In fact, it's pretty old school.  But if you're looking for a phone that makes and receives calls, downloads lots of stuff from google play and reasonable quality and performance for the price, this phone is for you.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Happy Camper
Reviews.Content: Love this phone. Was able to activate easily and keep my phone number. Have had it a month and no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Sucks
Reviews.Author: mindy joseph
Reviews.Content: Not the phone just the service, we bought it and ended up not being able to get service for it in the area we live in which is Newport, VT. So we have no clue how the phone works because we never got a chance to use it.... :(

Reviews.Title: Not Bad, but not perfect either
Reviews.Author: Derek Heath "Heath ,Derek"
Reviews.Content: Not speedy as far as Internet. Not all Apps will work on this phone. It has Limitations. I live in a remote area with limited towers so reception is not the best on this phone. But price is good for unlimited calls,text and Internet.

Reviews.Title: ok starter but no memory
Reviews.Author: patrick moats
Reviews.Content: cant have alot with it and is super slow have a large memory card but not enough phone memory. and wont allow you to switch all onto the memory card

Reviews.Title: Worth the buy!
Reviews.Author: ava charbonneau
Reviews.Content: Love this phone so much, it's much better than the previous net10 android I had! I like the keyboard, and I love the options this phone comes with! Easy and fast to use I haven't had any problems with it and had this phone for months :)

Reviews.Title: Great phone for first time adroid users and needing a keyboard
Reviews.Author: nancy crotty
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this phone 2 yrs ago. I have loved the phone most of it's life =)  It has been a good phone and has done what I needed it to do. My biggest complaint is it takes to long to take a picture.  I have missed many great pics of my granddaughter because it takes a couple of seconds from the time you hit the button to it actually taking the picture. That has been constant throughout the life of the phone. I still have my phone and it still works fine. Things are starting to go a little haywire, like it dropped all of my contacts so I can't just store numbers in my phone. I still have most of the numbers in under favorite, but I can't just put in a contact under favorite if I don't already have the number in the phone. If the number is in my caller ID I can add it to my favorites. My husband paid the $180 for it 2 yrs ago. You can get it for $50 now. I think it's worth it if you don't want or need the upgrade. Perfect for teens. I would recommend this phone. I think if you've experienced less than this with the phone, you've just gotten a lemon.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Lizzie Who
Reviews.Content: Nice Phone, great keyboard. Weak GPS function. Solid build, easy to use, short battery life and requires frequent charging at least 2 times per day.

Reviews.Title: too bulky can't find a case to fit it
Reviews.Author: Leslie Blackmon
Reviews.Content: phone is way too bulkycan't find a case to fit it because of the battery packneeds sim card

Reviews.Title: not a good phone
Reviews.Author: myra truss
Reviews.Content: this phone does not pick up good too many drop calls had to go buy more memory this is worst phone I have bought

Reviews.Title: wrong
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: i got the phone and tried to hook it up though net10 and it wasn't even a net10 phone so wasted my time and money on this item

Reviews.Title: Great budget slider phone
Reviews.Author: Erik J. Sawyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement for my previous phone of the same model (note: Net10 only provides a one-year warranty; beyond that, it's up to you to replace it).  Works the same as my old one.Pros:Real QWERTY keyboard.  Android OS.  microSD-HC slot (I keep it loaded with a 32GB card).  Net10 unlimited service is one of the cheapest out there, at $45/month for truly *unlimited* talk/text/data (in over 3 years, I have *never* had Net10 throttle my service because I was using too much).  Slider mechanism is smooth and solid.Cons:Keyboard is only three rows, would be even better with four.  Android 2.3 is capable, but getting a bit old, and there's no (authorized) way to upgrade.  The internal memory on this phone is somewhat limited, which means you can only install a handful of apps before you start moving things to the SD card...and not everything *can* be moved to the SD card.  Camera is a capable, but fairly humdrum, 3.2MP (and no flash).  Data service is limited to 3G (use WiFi when available).  Battery life is decent, unless processor-intensive apps (Google maps, Angry Birds, etc) are running.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE! Net10 will be the worst experience of your life! Absolute Nightmare!
Reviews.Author: Darob
Reviews.Content: Despite reading a number of awful reviews on the web about Net10 and their parent company TracFone, my son-in-law has a NET10 account and hasn't had any major problems, so I decided to give it a try too.I received my LG Optimus Q directly from Net10 and was able to get it working fine for a few hours. The LG Optimus Q (sometimes also called the Optimus Slider) is a good phone, works good. However I discovered that Net10 assigned me a phone number in the wrong area code (they use your postal zip code to determine what area code to assign, a mistake since many postal zip codes contain several area codes). It took a while to get through to their customer support, but when I did, the person who spoke only broken English seemed very helpful and polite and I assumed that the assignment of a new number would go fine. I WAS GREATLY MISTAKEN. After the call, the phone immediately stopped working, and I never could get it working again.All attempts to get a signal again in the area of the new assigned number, failed. I even went and sat beneath one of the cell towers in the revised area code, to be sure it was connecting with the right zone... but no luck. After making repeated calls (you get either busy signals or they place you on hold for extended periods) and sending several emails, I finally got through to a tech (another one who could barely speak English), followed her recommendations exactly... nothing worked. I tried calling and emailing them again... and finally an obviously irritated tech returned my call (this one spoke the worst English of any of them), who basically repeated the steps I had already followed through with... which I repeated, and which failed as well.Since I am an IT manager and also have a communications degree, I assumed that I could patiently slog my way through their struggling technical support efforts... and help them to assist me... but to no avail. After wasting many days with this nonsense, I called and emailed again to request a refund and to return the phone. After repeated efforts, I finally got a refund for the phone... but they would not refund the one month's airtime, which was an outrage considering that I received no usage from it.As far as I can tell, none of their customer support reps (that I spoke with) can communicate clearly in English... but neither are they sufficiently skilled with either the technology or the particular phones to assist customers. Worst of all, the company's final solution for dissatisfaction is to wear the customer down until he or she gives up.In my many years of dealing with all sorts of customer and technical support issues, this is the absolute worst I've ever experienced. If, like my son-in-law, you are able to get the phone working immediately and have no need to contact their technical support... you are one of the lucky ones, and will probably be able to survive their service.However if you have any need that will require you to contact customer service, you would be better off to throw the phone in the trash and bang your head against the wall until you come to your senses... then go out and spent mucho bucks to secure services with a legitimate phone company such as Verizon, with whom I've been a customer for 20+ years. I despise the arrogance of their prices, but no one can argue with their service.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: kristin t
Reviews.Content: Was thrilled that the product arrived well within the projected delivery time & in perfect condition! I gave it to my son for Christmas and he loves it!

Reviews.Title: great product, but not for novices
Reviews.Author: mike garber
Reviews.Content: The Android OS is way too complex and has a steep learning curve, an in depth manual would be great!  However, I'm enjoying it imensely. The stuff I thoughf. Would be easy is hard and vice versa,  Amazon is a fine vendor,

Reviews.Title: Phone lasted only 90 days, very limited coverage area
Reviews.Author: Michael Persell
Reviews.Content: Phone lasted only 90 days, very limited coverage area.  If you plan any travel at all leave this at home

Reviews.Title: Not the Best Not the Worst
Reviews.Author: Nathan McLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Phone does its job for a cheap android. I hate the touch screen keyboard..but otherwise its a reasonable phone for the price.

Reviews.Title: Net10 LG Optimus Q
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I loved this phone when I ordered it but it was a waste of money. There is no service in my area. A very big disappointment.If you buy this phone make sure you have sprint coverage for smart phone in your area.

Reviews.Title: disappointed =(
Reviews.Author: jill
Reviews.Content: i love android op systems... but disappointed because i bought this phone... and it doesnt work in my area =( 183.00 wasted

Reviews.Title: defected phone
Reviews.Author: jose
Reviews.Content: Thes phones not to good it gets hot and dont charge good enough. I wont recomend it to nobody. Thank you.
